info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 4:21PM CDT until August 14 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Milwaukee River Near Cedarburg affecting Ozaukee County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Milwaukee River near Cedarburg.
* WHEN...Until early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Floodwaters affect Island Drive and Shoreland Parkway in the Mequon area. Water is over Elm St, Green Bay Rd, North Cedarburg Rd in Thiensville. The following roads and intersections are flooded and closed: Highway Y and Hawthorne Drive in the Town of Saukville, Highway W between Highway 33 and Highway 57 in the Village of Saukville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM CDT Monday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 03/17/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
